intro: Koanophyllon grandiceps, commonly known as the large-headed goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant has silver-green, woolly leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Koanophyllon grandiceps is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in full sun with minimal water.
